newsitem.title: POLAND: Optimus tumbles 10 pct in heavy trade.
newsitem.headline: Optimus tumbles 10 pct in heavy trade.

text.p: Polish computer maker Optimus SA plunged the daily maximum 10 percent to 112.5 zlotys in heavy trade after the company on Tuesday denied a market rumour that Microsoft had bought most of its convertible bonds.
"Many investors expected Microsoft to take shares after exchanging the convertible bonds, so they (investors) reacted dramatically to the news," one trader said.
Optimus said on Tuesday that its 300 international convertible bonds at a par value of $100,000 each had been placed with financial investors from Asia and Europe.
But analysts said the stock should rebound in the next few sessions after the firm's Tuesday forecast that 1997 net profit would rise to 30 million zlotys from 16.5 million in 1996.
